faq.question: How can I find nearby EV charging stations?
faq.answer: Use your city's official EV map or apps like PlugShare or Google Maps. Filter by connector type (CCS, CHAdeMO, Type 2) and power level.

faq.question: How much does charging cost?
faq.answer: Prices vary by operator. Typical DC fast charging is priced per kWh or per minute. Many public Level 2 chargers are free or low-cost. Check the operator's app or on-site signage.

faq.question: When are charging stations open?
faq.answer: Most public stations are available 24/7, but access and parking rules can vary. Always check the site details in the app or with the operator.

faq.question: Are there grants or incentives for installing a charger?
faq.answer: Yes. Government programs often offer grants, tax credits, or rebates for eligible sites. See the 'Apply to set up a station' guidance for the latest programs.

faq.question: What are the technical requirements to install a station?
faq.answer: Requirements typically include certified hardware, appropriate connector types, safety compliance, accessibility, and OCPP networking. Power capacity and grid upgrades may be required.

faq.question: How do I apply to set up an EV charging station?
faq.answer: Prepare site details (address, power capacity, proposed connectors), ownership documentation, and a plan for operations. Submit an application via the government portal. You will receive an application ID like APP-123456 to track status.
